other_tests.findings: Opening pressure of 25 cm of water; glucose level was 100 mg per deciliter; protein level was elevated at 127 mg per deciliter; 127 red cells and 2 white cells per cubic millimeter in cerebrospinal fluid.
Interstitial plasmacytosis consistent with a plasma-cell dyscrasia, with 4.8% lambda-restricted plasma cells; no evidence of amyloid.
Absence of sural-nerve sensory responses and peroneal-nerve motor responses; left arm showed normal sensory and motor amplitudes but reduced conduction velocities.
Neurogenic motor-unit morphologic features and recruitment with abnormal spontaneous activity in distal muscles of lower extremities.
Identified an IgA lambda monoclonal gammopathy (M-protein level, 0.3 g per deciliter).
